items.abstractNote: Scaling up the sparse matrix-vector multiplication kernel on modern Graphics Processing Units (GPU) has been at the heart of numerous studies in both academia and industry. In this article we present a novel non-parametric, self-tunable, approach to data representation for computing this kernel, particularly targeting sparse matrices representing power-law graphs. Using real web graph data, we show how our representation scheme, coupled with a novel tiling algorithm, can yield significant benefits over the current state of the art GPU efforts on a number of core data mining algorithms such as PageRank, HITS and Random Walk with Restart.
items.conferenceName: 37th International Conference on Very Large Data Bases
items.shortTitle: Fast sparse matrix-vector multiplication on GPUs
items.title: Fast sparse matrix-vector multiplication on GPUs: implications for graph mining
